beats.title: Arrival at Rajmahal Signals a Life Shift
beats.scene_ref: EXT. GRAND ROAD / RAJMAHAL OUTER GATE - DAY
screenplay_lines: Ek badi se gadi (Luxury Car) is running on grand road.
gadi is entering to the grand outer gate of Rajmahal.
Gadi rajmahal ki main building ke bahar aake rukti hai...
beats.description: A luxury arrival establishes status, scale, and the impending change of home and identity.

shots.intent: Introduce the luxury car as a symbol of power and transition; the audience feels the weight of an important arrival approaching something larger than life.
shots.narrative_function: Establishing the inciting visual premise (status + movement toward destiny) while staying minimal and readable in vertical framing.

shots.intent: Show the car crossing into the Rajmahal outer gate; communicates crossing a social boundary and entering a world of tradition and scrutiny.
shots.narrative_function: Transition beat marker—moving from public road to royal domain; sets scale without dense detail (gate silhouette, light shafts).

shots.intent: Car comes to a stop outside the main building; the stillness after motion signals finality—this life change is now unavoidable.
shots.narrative_function: Punctuation end-cap to the arrival beat; sets up the reveal of people and reactions in the next beat.

beats.title: Servants' Gossip: Judgment and Class Tension
beats.scene_ref: EXT. RAJMAHAL MAIN BUILDING ENTRANCE - CONTINUOUS
screenplay_lines: sabhi naukar aapas me khusar pusar kar rahe hain….
Kya sach me rajkumari is gareeb driver se shaadi karengi…
Kya kismat hai uski..seedha road se mahal…
Sab use dekh kar muh bana rahe hain ...
beats.description: The household frames the situation as scandalous, revealing prejudice and social stakes around the marriage.

shots.intent: Isolate a small cluster of servants whispering; their hushed energy turns the palace into a courtroom, signaling the newcomer will be watched and judged.
shots.narrative_function: Introduce social pressure as an antagonistic force; establishes the palace’s collective gaze.

shots.intent_title: The Line That Cuts: Naukarani’s Question
shots.intent: Close-up on the naukarani delivering: “Kya sach me rajkumari is gareeb driver se shaadi karengi…” with a faint sneer; lands the core prejudice plainly.
shots.narrative_function: Deliver key exposition (class scandal) with maximum emotional clarity in a simple, AI-friendly close-up.

shots.intent: Quick readable reaction of servants ‘muh banana’ toward the arrival direction; communicates rejection before the protagonists even appear.
shots.narrative_function: Reaction bridge to the upcoming reveal of Gayatri/Sia/Pyarelaal; amplifies stakes via public disdain.

beats.title: Gayatri Enters: Power Move Amid Scrutiny
screenplay_lines: Tabhi car se ek nice dress me gayatri utarti hai..
Uske peeche Sia aur Pyarelaal bhi utarte hain.....
beats.description: Gayatri’s presence shifts the energy from rumor to reality; the trio’s arrival invites immediate comparison and judgment.

shots.intent: Medium close-up of Gayatri stepping out in a nice dress—calm, composed, eyes forward—showing she owns the moment despite the watching crowd.
shots.narrative_function: Character introduction as power center; converts gossip into reality with a decisive reveal.

shots.intent: Sia emerges from the car just behind Gayatri, framed smaller to emphasize protection and dependency; signals innocence entering a harsh social arena.
shots.narrative_function: Introduce child dynamic and set up the wonder beat; positions Gayatri as anchor.

shots.intent: Pyarelaal exits after them, catching the servants’ gaze; his presence completes the triangle and invites the class-judgment contrast hinted in whispers.
shots.narrative_function: Complete the trio introduction; plants the power-imbalance tension that will erupt in Beat 5.

beats.title: Sia’s Wonder, Gayatri’s Claim: This Is Home Now
screenplay_lines: Wow ye rajmahal to filmon wale mahal se bhi bada hai....
Gayatri smile karti hai use dekh kar....
beats.description: Sia reacts with childlike awe; Gayatri emotionally anchors the transition by declaring permanence and offering warmth.

shots.intent_title: Child’s Eyes on a Giant World
shots.intent: Close-up on Sia looking upward, light reflecting in her eyes as she says: “Wow ye rajmahal to filmon wale mahal se bhi bada hai....” emphasizing pure wonder against a soft, minimal palace backdrop.
shots.narrative_function: Shift tone from judgment to childhood awe; rehumanizes the arrival through Sia’s perspective.

shots.intent: Tight two-shot (Gayatri foreground, Sia slightly below) as Gayatri says: “Ab yahi tumhara ghar hai...” delivering reassurance with quiet authority—this is not a visit, it’s a takeover of fate.
shots.narrative_function: Anchor the story’s premise (new home/new identity) while reinforcing Gayatri as protector/decider.

shots.intent: Close-up on Sia: “Sacchi mummy....” then cut within the same shot moment to Gayatri’s gentle smile landing like a promise, softening the palace’s harshness.
shots.narrative_function: Emotional button to the beat; creates intimacy before the next power clash.

beats.title: Public Boundary: Gayatri Keeps Pyarelaal in His Place
screenplay_lines: Dekho zyada chipakne ki koshish mat karna... Abhi tak tumne mujhe nahi haraya hai... Wo to baki yoddha tumhe mil kar maar na den isliye maine tumhe select kar liya.... samjhe? Now follow me...
beats.description: Pyarelaal seeks affection and status through a nickname; Gayatri shuts it down, asserting dominance and setting strict relational rules.

shots.intent: Medium close-up on Gayatri issuing: “Pyarelaal chalo” without softness; establishes her as commander while servants remain an implied off-screen audience.
shots.narrative_function: Initiate the power dynamic confrontation; sets a public stage for the boundary line.

shots.intent: Close-up on Pyarelaal attempting: “Pyare boliye na..” with a needy half-smile that reads as overfamiliar; shows his desire for status/intimacy in front of others.
shots.narrative_function: Position Pyarelaal as socially misaligned; creates the setup for Gayatri’s shutdown.

shots.intent: Tight close-up on Gayatri turning serious and delivering: “Dekho zyada chipakne ki koshish mat karna... … samjhe? Now follow me...” Her gaze is steady; the words land like a slap, clarifying he is chosen, not cherished.
shots.narrative_function: Core power statement of the sequence; defines relational rules and sets ongoing conflict engine.

beats.title: Pyarelaal Left Hanging: The Sting Lands
screenplay_lines: Gayatri bol ke aage badh jati hai....
pyarelaal muh bana kar khada hai....
beats.description: Gayatri exits the exchange decisively, leaving Pyarelaal to absorb the public rejection.

shots.intent: Medium shot on Gayatri’s back/shoulder as she moves forward decisively; she doesn’t look back, communicating finality and control.
shots.narrative_function: Exit action that seals the power play; transitions the focus to Pyarelaal’s emotional fallout.

shots.intent: Close-up on Pyarelaal ‘muh bana’—tight jaw, wounded eyes—frozen while the world moves on; the rejection becomes personal and public.
shots.narrative_function: Consequence shot; crystallizes humiliation to motivate his next behavior toward Sia.

beats.title: Sia Teases, Pyarelaal Snaps: New Family Friction
screenplay_lines: naam to aapka hai pyare.. Par mummy dikha gayi aapko din me taare....
Haan sab teri wajah se hua hai.. Chuhiya...
beats.description: Sia punctures the tension with humor; Pyarelaal redirects his bruised ego into petty hostility, establishing ongoing domestic conflict.

shots.intent: Close-up on Sia delivering: “naam to aapka hai pyare.. Par mummy dikha gayi aapko din me taare....” with playful confidence; her humor is a child’s attempt to process adult cruelty.
shots.narrative_function: Release valve after tension; also triggers the next conflict by poking Pyarelaal’s bruised pride.

shots.intent: Close-up on Pyarelaal snapping: “Haan sab teri wajah se hua hai.. Chuhiya...” His face hardens—he transfers humiliation downward to someone safer to attack.
shots.narrative_function: Establish Pyarelaal’s flawed coping mechanism; defines a new internal family friction.

shots.intent: Tight two-shot with Sia correcting: “Papa chuhiya nahi siya....” then Pyarelaal dismissing: “Haan haan chal....” showing her dignity versus his impatience; ends with her small pause before moving.
shots.narrative_function: Button the scene’s new dynamic (child stands up; father figure belittles); sets the emotional runway for subsequent palace conflicts.
